note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers also the burning of low-grade fuel of solid, liquid, or gaseous nature.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Furnaces for cremation of human or animal carcasses

CPC-specific-text.text: General arrangement of incineration plant, e.g. flow sheets
adapted for burning two or more kinds, e.g. liquid and solid, of waste being fed through separate inlets

reference.text: pyrolisation of sludge C02F11/00; destructive distillation of carbonaceous materials C10B53/00

CPC-specific-text.text: High-temperature heating means, e.g. plasma, for partly melting the waste

title-part.text: having a vertical, substantially cylindrical, combustion chamber
the waste being subjected to a whirling movement, e.g. cyclonic incinerators
the waste being burnt in a pit or arranged in a heap for combustion
having a conical combustion chamber, e.g. "teepee" incinerators

CPC-specific-text.text: in which the waste is fed in containers or the like

title-part.text: Incinerators or other apparatus for consuming industrial waste, e.g. chemicals

reference.text: incinerator closets A47K11/02; oxidation of sludge C02F11/06; burners in general, burner details F23D; incinerating radioactive waste G21F9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: for sludges or waste products from water treatment installations

reference.text: production and refining of metals C22B, e.g. from scrap to produce non-ferrous metals C22B7/00; salvaging material from cables H01B15/003
waste oil F23G7/05, waste liquors F23G7/04, sludges F23G7/001

title-part.text: of bagasse, megasse or the like
of waste liquors, e.g. sulfite liquors
of waste gases or noxious gases, e.g. exhaust gases

reference.text: exhaust apparatus for engines with means for rendering the exhaust innocuous, e.g. by thermal or catalytic conversion, F01N3/08; combustion of uncombusted material from primary combustion within apparatus for combustion of solid or fluent fuel F23B,

CPC-specific-text.text: of non combusted material from primary combustion of solid fuels F23B5/00; of gases produced by primary combustion of solid fuels F23B90/04
preheating the waste gas by the heat of the combustion, e.g. recuperation type incinerator

title-part.text: in which combustion takes place in the presence of catalytic material
of contaminated soil, e.g. by oil
with recirculation of unburned solid or gaseous matter into combustion chamber
in a matrix bed combustion chamber
with endless chain or travelling grate
with charging ports in the sidewall
with air supply ports in the sidewall
with variable inclination of rotation axis
Arrangement of a plurality of drums
Sealing arrangements between rotary and stationary parts
with support for a grate or perforated plate
with external recirculation of entrained bed material
with recirculation of bed material inside combustion chamber
with two or more fluidised beds
with essentially horizontal flow of bed material
with fluidised bed rotated as a whole
Furnaces with other means for moving the waste through the combustion zone
reintroducing the heat in the same process, e.g. for predrying
using the heat in association with another installation
Preventing or abating fire or explosion, e.g. by purging
Sludge, slurries or mixtures of liquids
Solid combustion residues, e.g. bottom or flyash
Special features of, or arrangements for incinerators
Combination of two or more furnaces
Burning with downwards directed draft through the waste mass
Waste oxidation, pyrolysis or gasification in water under supercritical conditions
Waste in combustion chamber supported on bed made of special materials
Combustion chamber walls reflecting radiant energy within the chamber
Co-combustion of two or more kinds of waste, separately fed into the furnace
Combustion of waste suspended or lifted by upward gas flows
Furnace with progressive waste movements in vertical or steeply inclined direction
Waste pyrolysis, gasification or cracking by indirect heat transfer
Waste pyrolysis, gasification or cracking in presence of catalysts
Waste pyrolysis, gasification or cracking in a mechanically fluidised bed, e.g. obtained by a centrifugal force
Waste pre-treatment by pyrolysis, gasification or cracking
Waste pre-treatment by pyrolysis, gasification or cracking followed by condensation of gas into combustible oil or fat
Thermoforming of plastic waste materials before combustion
Biologic treatment before burning, e.g. biogas generation
Evaporating, e.g. liquid waste before burning
Preheating processes other than drying or pyrolysis
Drying waste by mixing with drying chemicals, e.g. with CaO
Providing additional energy for combustion, e.g. by using supplementary heating
using the heat from externally heated bodies, e.g. steel balls
using thermit or other compositions of metal oxides as auxiliary fuel
using arc discharge electrodes to provide heat
Rotary drums with co-current flows of waste and gas
Rotary drum furnaces with counter-current flows of waste and gas
Rotary drum furnaces with foramenous drum walls, e.g. grate drums
Hearths or supports movable into and from the furnace, e.g. by a conveyor
Feeding waste in containers, bags or barrels
using waste heat for desalinating sea water
Sensing for exhaust gas properties, e.g. O2 content
Sensors arranged in waste loading zone, e.g. feed hopper level
Controlling stoker grate speed or vibrations for waste movement
Detecting the properties of waste to be incinerated, e.g. heating value, density
Air bags or seat belt pre-tensioners
Animal fat, e.g. lard, tallow, stearin
Incinerating litter from animals, e.g. poultry litter
Incinerating remains of building materials after demolishing, e.g. fibreglass asphalt shingles
Incinerating human or animal corpses or remains
Incinerating rice or grain husks, hulls or bran
Incinerating drainage water from waste pits of incinerators
Temporary storage means, e.g. buffers for accumulating fumes or gases, between treatment stages
